item.description: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

item.title: Federal government's agriculture emissions reductions 'ambitious' but 'achievable'
item.description: A professor of carbon farming says the agriculture industry will "naturally" contribute to a 28 per cent emissions reduction projected by 2050, but is unlikely to hit its own net-zero targets.

item.title: Matt Kean on the govt's 2035 emissions target || Insiders: On Background
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pink Floyd's album and ode to Syd Barrett Wish You Were Here turns 50
item.description: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

item.title: Labor reshuffles its furniture as the Liberals try to save what’s left
item.description: Two resigning ministers, two major broken promises and an unfolding ecological crisis confront SA Labor six months out from a state election. Yet it's the Liberal Party staring down electoral punishment.

item.title: Judge throws out Donald Trump's multi-billion-dollar New York Times lawsuit
item.description: The US president's $US15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times has been labelled "improper" by a federal judge.

item.title: What time does the F1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix start? How can I watch it?
item.description: Oscar Piastri returns to the streets of Baku — one year on from a terrific victory — holding a 31-point lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

item.title: Freezing rain or 12,000km away, these green Vikings will do anything for their beloved Canberra Raiders
item.description: Simon Tayoun's been a devout member of the Green Army since he watched his first-ever game of rugby league in 1987, and now he's become an unofficial mascot by bringing his custom drum to every game he can to lead the Viking Clap.

item.title: Perth family endure cold, wet winter in bus amid worsening housing crisis
item.description: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

item.title: Storm damage sees shark net installation delay at Sydney's Shark Beach in Nielsen Park
item.description: Shark Beach in Sydney's east is seasonally netted with an enclosure to protect swimmers from sharks during Sydney's warmer months — but for the upcoming school holidays, it is unlikely the nets will be installed in time.

item.title: Remote NSW council holds election after 12 years in administration
item.description: The 700 voters living in the remote Central Darling Shire Council area of New South Wales will finally head to the polls to vote again.

item.title: Tasmania's tree fern trade accused of 'greenwashing' over native forest logging links, but others say it is sustainable
item.description: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

item.title: Chelsea FC Women's star Sam Kerr presented with special football to mark 100 goals for club
item.description: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

item.title: Victor Caulfield moved to Florence in his 70s and became an artists' model
item.description: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

item.title: British couple freed from Afghanistan's Taliban
item.description: The couple, who ran a charity in Afghanistan where they had lived for 18 years, were freed after months of negotiations with the Taliban by Qatar in coordination with Britain.

item.title: South Australians reflect on life, 50 years after homosexuality was decriminalised
item.description: Since homosexuality was decriminalised in South Australia half a century ago, LGBTIQA+ people say the state has made strides, but there is still some way to go towards equality.

item.title: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner - ABC News
item.description: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

item.title: Eucalypt trail named after botanist Dean Nicolle opens in SA
item.description: A unique partnership between an artist and a botanist has resulted in an old rail corridor in South Australia becoming an eucalypt forest.

item.title: More than 800 Indonesian students get food poisoning from free school meals
item.description: Over 800 students fall sick in two cases of mass food poisoning in one week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government.

item.title: Kianga coal mine tragedy 50 years later and the reforms that followed
item.description: Half a century after the Kianga mine explosion killed 13 workers in central Queensland, a community gathers to remember the tragedy as survivors and experts raise fresh concerns about ongoing safety risks.

item.title: 'America is not happy': ABC under fire for pulling Jimmy Kimmel Live!
item.description: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

item.title: Wide Bay affordable housing estate scrapped due to 'unfeasible' costs
item.description: A controversial housing estate that would have been built on 26 hectares of Bundaberg's green space has been scrapped.

item.title: Canada beats New Zealand 34-19 to reach Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: A changing of the guard in women's rugby union as two-time defending world champions New Zealand is beaten for the first time at the tournament since 2014 by a brilliant Canadian side.

item.title: Victorian apiarists finding it harder to access public land 'vital' for bees

item.title: World-first turtle tracking reveals secrets of flatback turtles in WA's Roebuck Bay
item.description: GPS tracking, motion sensors and video cameras reveal where flatback turtles in Broome's Roebuck Bay feed and travel, contributing to a richer understanding of the vulnerable species.

item.title: Optus admits it had early warning about triple-0 failure as fourth death confirmed
item.description: Optus reveals it received an early warning of Thursday's system failure — which has since been linked to a fourth death — hours before the situation was fixed, but that it did not respond appropriately to complaints from concerned customers.

item.description: Police were called to two separate domestic-related incidents in New South Wales overnight.

item.title: UN says there's evidence organised crime scam centres are moving from South-East Asia into new frontier of the Pacific
item.description: As scam centres run by organised crime find it harder to operate in South-East Asia, evidence emerges of them moving into the Pacific and setting up lucrative operations estimated to net billions each year.

item.title: Transition from sheep to cropping in WA's Avon Valley leaving limited balloon landing sites
item.description: The move out of sheep by an increasing number of WA farmers is having an unexpected impact on the state's hot air balloon pilots.

item.description: Yolŋu children from nine Laynhapuy communities are screaming the Yothu Yindi anthem, Homeland Movement, in a ceremony celebrating the Indigenous elders who claimed back life on their country 50 years ago.

item.description: A Queensland community is reaping the rewards of establishing the first regional professional netball team in the national league.

item.description: WA Premier Roger Cook says police are investigating whether a second person in Western Australia died after attempting to call triple-0 during an Optus outage on Thursday.

item.title: Ten-year-old Amina was fetching water when a missile strike killed her

item.description: Backup dancers and backing singers spend years perfecting their craft. But who are these artists and how does it feel performing in the shadows of superstars?

item.description: Local Government Minister Hannah Beazely condemns the emergence of "extremist" candidates nominating for the state's forthcoming council elections.

item.title: Trump will impose a $150,000 annual fee for H-1B visas. Here's what it means
item.description: Some hope this visa price hike will see the US tech industry prioritise American workers. Others argue it'll dissuade the "world's smartest talent" from choosing to work in the US.

item.title: Kangaroos beat Blues for 18th straight AFLW win as Cats, Hawks and Dockers triumph
item.description: Reigning premiers North Melbourne thrashes Carlton by 53 points, while Port Adelaide is stunned by an umpiring decision in its narrow loss to Geelong.

item.title: Crowds flock to Toowoomba Carnival of Flowers despite wet weather
item.description: Cold and damp conditions have not been enough to keep people away from Toowoomba's annual floral extravaganza.

item.title: Brisbane defeats Colingwood by 29 points to advance to third straight AFL grand final
item.description: The Brisbane Lions advance to a third consecutive season decider where they will face Geelong after defeating Collingwood by 29 points.

item.title: Sharks and Knights reach NRLW preliminary finals
item.description: Cronulla keeps its season alive by defeating North Queensland, as Newcastle advances to a fourth NRLW preliminary final.

item.title: NRL finals updates: Cronulla Sharks defeat Canberra Raiders 32-12 in semifinal
item.description: The Canberra Raiders have become the first NRL minor premier to be eliminated from the finals in straight sets, going down to the Cronulla Sharks in a sudden-death semifinal. Follow live.

item.title: Queensland's measles outbreak growing after case confirmed in rural town Middlemount
item.description: A rural town in central Queensland is the latest community affected, after a case was recorded in Middlemount.

item.title: Men's 4x400m relay team disqualified after national record, Mackenzie Little wins bronze at World Championships
item.description: The celebrations were cut short soon after the finish when the team were disqualified for a faulty changeover.

item.title: Brazilian race walker Ciao Bonfim loses wedding ring in race, wins maiden gold at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Brazilian race walker Ciao Bonfim won a gold medal in the 20km race walk, the first major global title of his career. But he lost something important on the way.

item.title: F1 Azerbaijan qualifying: Oscar Piastri crashes out in Baku, Max Verstappen secures pole
item.description: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri crashed out of qualifying in Azerbaijan, but his teammate and championship rival Lando Norris was unable to make the Australian pay.

item.title: Republicans seize on Charlie Kirk's death to crack down on liberal dissent that puts freedom of speech 'in peril'
item.description: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.

item.title: What is 'Solastalgia' and how are climate-affected communities tackling it?
item.description: If you're overwhelmed by emissions targets, climate change and environmental collapse, start small and look to First Nations practices to help your wellbeing and the world around you.

item.title: Antinatalists say human suffering, and climate change, makes having children unethical. Are they right?
item.description: Elon Musk believes the collapsing birth rate is humanity's biggest danger. But antinatalists argue having kids is little more than a procreational Ponzi scheme, and the risks are real.

item.title: Asia's protests grew from social media where misinformation also spread
item.description: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: What makes China confident enough to ban microchips made by US firm Nvidia?
item.description: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Cyber attack on Collins Aerospace disrupts check-in systems at major European airports
item.description: The attack on a provider of check-in and boarding systems causes mass disruption at several major European airports, including London's Heathrow.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will meet Donald Trump next week as Russia intensifies attacks
item.description: The Ukrainian president says he will hold "a meeting with the President of the United States" to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: 'We should kill him': AI chatbot encourages Australian man to murder his father
item.description: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

item.title: Hard Quiz: So you think you're a trivia guru? Go on, prove it!
item.description: I like your trivia enthusiasm, but be careful — you're about to taste defeat.

item.title: When is Charlie Kirk's memorial service? How to watch it in Australia
item.description: A public memorial service will be held for the late political commentator at a stadium in the US state of Arizona.
